title: How to Make a Button Flower Arrangement

steps.headline: Assemble the supplies needed.
steps.description: These are listed below. In particular, you will need to match three buttons in descending size to make each button flower. Choose buttons according to their interest and colors. You may wish to color theme them, or make a more eclectic arrangement.

steps.headline: Make the flowers first.
steps.description: Assemble three buttons on top of each other. They should be in descending order, with the largest at the base and the smallest on top.

steps.headline: Loop the wire up through one side set of aligned holes, then bring it down the other side (only two sets of holes is needed).
steps.description: Pull the loop firmly into place to draw together the three buttons and wrap the wire neatly in place underneath the large button, around the wire length. Use pliers to help you wind it, if needed.

steps.headline: Measure enough of the wire length that you wrapped the wire around to create a stem.
steps.description: Cut at the end to form the stem. The button flower will be sitting pretty at one end, the other end ready to be inserted into the arrangement.

steps.headline: Repeat for more flowers on stems.
steps.description: Vary the stem lengths to make the result reflect a real bunch of flowers in a container.

steps.headline: Create the container for the flowers.
steps.description: Cut down the florist's foam to size and insert into the container. Cover the foam with dried moss or other floral cover to prettify it.

steps.headline: Arrange the button flowers in the container.
steps.description: Simply insert the wire stem end into the florist's foam in different places. Rearrange until you're happy with the final look. If you don't want to use florist's wire, find a pretty bottle and simply slip the wire stems into it.

text: Assemble the supplies needed. These are listed below. In particular, you will need to match three buttons in descending size to make each button flower. Choose buttons according to their interest and colors. You may wish to color theme them, or make a more eclectic arrangement. Make the flowers first. Assemble three buttons on top of each other. They should be in descending order, with the largest at the base and the smallest on top. Loop the wire up through one side set of aligned holes, then bring it down the other side (only two sets of holes is needed). Pull the loop firmly into place to draw together the three buttons and wrap the wire neatly in place underneath the large button, around the wire length. Use pliers to help you wind it, if needed. Measure enough of the wire length that you wrapped the wire around to create a stem. Cut at the end to form the stem. The button flower will be sitting pretty at one end, the other end ready to be inserted into the arrangement. Repeat for more flowers on stems. Vary the stem lengths to make the result reflect a real bunch of flowers in a container. Create the container for the flowers. Cut down the florist's foam to size and insert into the container. Cover the foam with dried moss or other floral cover to prettify it. Arrange the button flowers in the container. Simply insert the wire stem end into the florist's foam in different places. Rearrange until you're happy with the final look. If you don't want to use florist's wire, find a pretty bottle and simply slip the wire stems into it.
